DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Etiology Myelodysplastic Syndrome Diagnosis Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a description for the cause (origin) of development of myelodysplastic syndrome based on examination of a person and their medical history to identify exposure to treatments or associated risks.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: related to the cause (origin) resulting in development of myelodysplastic syndrome based on examination of a person and their medical history to identify exposure to treatments or associated risks.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the examination and treatment of patients.:The cause of a disease.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
The cause of a disease or abnormal condition.

Property.preferredDefinition: Myelodysplastic syndrome (MDS) is a clonal hematopoietic disorder characterized by dysplasia and ineffective hematopoiesis in one or more of the hematopoietic cell lines.  The dysplasia may be accompanied by an increase in myeloblasts, but the number is less than 20%, which, according to the WHO guidelines, is the requisite threshold for the diagnosis of acute myeloid leukemia.  MDS may occur de novo or as a result of exposure to alkylating agents and/or radiotherapy.  (WHO, 2001) -- 2003:The process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms.

Concepts.definition: A clonal hematopoietic disorder characterized by dysplasia and ineffective hematopoiesis in one or more of the hematopoietic cell lines. The dysplasia may be accompanied by an increase in myeloblasts, but the number is less than 20%, which, according to the WHO guidelines, is the requisite threshold for the diagnosis of acute myeloid leukemia. It may occur de novo or as a result of exposure to alkylating agents and/or radiotherapy. (WHO, 2001)

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).
